SEARCH
Package Game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
This program implements a simple game, where short stories are displayed and after that, the player answers simple questions.

This class is the main class of the program, which is responsible for the creation of the game, and setting up the game using PlayerSetup and CreatePlan classes. When all is set, the game is executed by calling play() method, where each Story is played. After them Questions are asked, Stats are displayed, and the game is ended by displaying TheEnd.
Since:
2023-05-09
Version:
1.0
Author:
Erik Rogansk√Ω

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(String login, Boolean newGame) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      This constructor is used to load or create a new game. To decide which one it is, it uses parameter. It uses a try-catch and if-condition to test if the new game should be created or an old one can be loaded. If a new game should be created is thrown to execute the code in the catch part which catches and . Then a new game is set and automatically saved by calling save(). After all that play() method is executed.
      Parameters:
      login - is there to assign the login String.
      newGame - is there to check if a new game should be created, or it can be loaded.
      Throws:
      IOException
      ClassNotFoundException

    • Game

      public Game(Player player) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      This constructor is simply used play the game with the Player object passed to it.
      Parameters:
      player - is there just to assign the player, and it's login.
      Throws:
      IOException
      ClassNotFoundException

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play() throws IOException
      This method is used to manage the actual "playing" the game. It uses autosave principle as it calls save() method each time when the current step is finished. If the Plan.getCurrent() is less than 8, it calls Story.playStory(Player) method which executes the Story at that index. If the Plan.getCurrent() is equal to 8, it creates Questions class which creates the quiz. If the Plan.getCurrent() is equal to 9, it creates Stats class which displays the statistics. If the Plan.getCurrent() is equal to 10, it creates TheEnd class which displays 'The End' title.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • save

      public void save() throws IOException
      This method from Serializable interface is used to save the game.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • load

      public void load() throws ClassNotFoundException, IOException
      This method from Serializable interface is used to load the game.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      IOException

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      This static method is used to execute the whole program. First a Startup object is created and then the new game is created, with the parameters from the Startup object.
      Parameters:
      args - does nothing
      Throws:
      IOException
      ClassNotFoundException
